text: Highway museum complex is the Sri Lanka's first highway museum and is located in Kiribathkumbura, Kandy. The museum is maintained by the Road Development Authority. The museum has a collection of former construction equipment such as stone road rollers, steam road rollers, oil road rollers, tar boilers, coal scales, road signs and a model of the Bogoda Wooden Bridge. It is reported that some of the equipment on display is over 175 years old. == Opening hours == There are no entrance fees to visitors and there are no time limits since it is situated in an open space area alongside the A1 highway. ==See also== *List of museums in Sri Lanka == References == Category:Museums in Kandy District Category:Road transport in Sri Lanka Category:Transport museums
title: Highway museum complex, Kiribathkumbura
